Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Emma who felt very sad because she had moved to a new town. She missed her old friends and wondered if she would ever feel happy again. One day, she found a bouquet of bright yellow sunflowers on her doorstep with a note that said, "Welcome to our neighborhood!" Emma smiled for the first time in weeks. The flowers reminded her that hope could always bloom in unexpected places. And so, she began to feel hopeful andready to make new friends and explore her new home.

**Hope Part 2**  

Lila had the seed in her hand. She felt the warm sun on her face as she walked to the garden. The soil was dry, but she smiled. She dug a small hole and gently placed the seed inside. "Grow," she whispered. She watered it every day. Days passed. One morning, a tiny green芽 appeared! Lila jumped with joy. She showed her friend, Sam, who smiled. "You did it!" Sam said. Lila’s seed grew into a tall plant with colorful flowers. Lila felt happy. She knew hope can grow, just like the seed.
